messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] combining structure with non-structure
messages.msgSnippet: That was an EXCELLENT article.  Thank you for pointing me to it.  I bookmarked it and I bookmarked his site. All newbies should read it. THanks again Kristen
messages.messageBody:
That was an EXCELLENT article. Thank you for pointing me to it. I bookmarked it and I bookmarked his site.

All newbies should read it.

THanks again

Kristen
----- Original Message -----
From: warblwarbl@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, April 07, 2003 4:49 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] combining structure with non-structure


Someone asked about research re: whether adding structure to non-structure is
harmful. Alfie Kohn has an article called "Education' s Rotten Apples" in
Education Week , Sept. 18, 2002 (just Google it; I'm to bleary eyed to get
the link) that's on this topic. It basically says that providing structure
interferes with people's ability to construct their own knowledge. I thought
it was a great article.

Pam T.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
